alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:47AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Marion, southeastern Chattahoochee, eastern Stewart and Webster Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 347 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Manta to Brooklyn to near Sanford, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Preston, Richland, Weston, Putnam, Seminole, Christopher, Kimbrough, Westville, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Draneville, Manta, Zellobee, Leveretts, Troutman, Sanford, Doyle and Church Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
